intro: Neolehmannia pabstii, commonly known as the Pabst's leafy spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of succulent, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Neolehmannia pabstii is a perennial herb that is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
